definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: And if you are English, you'd avidly defend your words.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是英國人，你會迫切地要捍衛你的文字。

sentences.english: I am eager for them to do so.
sentences.chinese: 我迫切希望他們能夠這樣做。

sentences.english: But Holmes notes the most dramatic need is in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 然而，霍姆斯指出，最迫切需要援助的是巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Jamaicans have that urge to grow abroad.
sentences.chinese: 牙買加人有在國外發展的迫切願望。

sentences.english: With the impounding of Three Gorges Project, study on this problem became urgent.
sentences.chinese: 隨着三峽工程完工蓄水，這方面的研究顯得愈加迫切。

sentences.english: Wholly reducing bus interior noise level needs to consider multi -paths by which several noise sources radiate sound into the bus.
sentences.chinese: 整體降低客車車內噪聲水平的需求日益迫切。

sentences.english: The world is crying out for a lawgiver.
sentences.chinese: 這個世界迫切需要一個立法者。

sentences.english: By the study of educational arrangement, we can see the immediate request of reformation of school decision-making system.
sentences.chinese: 從教育領域來看，學校決策體制的改革要求非常迫切。

sentences.english: It raises new challenges and exigent needs for knowledge acquisition from text (KAT).
sentences.chinese: 這就爲文本知識獲取提出了新的挑戰和迫切需求。

sentences.english: It is pointed out that the establishment of national environmental monitoring information system (NEMIS) is urgent and feasible.
sentences.chinese: 分析了建立國家環境監理信息系統的迫切性和可行性。

sentences.english: Building resource-conserving society is an exigent mission.
sentences.chinese: 建設資源節約型社會是當前極爲迫切的任務。

sentences.english: New developments entail the formulation of rules for temporary actions.
sentences.chinese: 形勢的發展迫切需要一個臨時行動規則。

sentences.english: The research of high power LED driver circuit comes avid and challengeable.
sentences.chinese: 大功率LED的驅動電源研究顯得迫切而具有挑戰。

sentences.english: They decided to represent their urgent need to the District Party Committee.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定向區黨委反映他們的迫切需要。

sentences.english: So it is necessary to research the communication language in the multi-agent system.
sentences.chinese: 多代理系統的通信語言的研究也就越來越迫切。

sentences.english: She says the Africans currently residing in the camp are desperate to get away.
sentences.chinese: 現在住在收容營裏的非洲人迫切希望離開。

definition: to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
hope and expectation/to anticipate/to look forward to/to await expectantly
pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
